Articles.Content:
Hello, welcome to the ship submission page for my Youtube series that is due to start soon. The first episode is nearly complete, and I've recorded the second one as of 9/11/2014.

Here is the trailer:

Ship submission Rules:

1. All craft must be stock. NO MODDED PARTS

2. All craft can be designed for zero gravity.

3. Infinite fuel, RCS and EVA fuel allowed.

4. No boosters required. All ships will launched into orbit by the secret weapon: "HYPEREDIT"

5. Give it a class name. EG: Wolf class cruiser, Destiny class fighter,

6. Put your name down in the craft description.

7. The side you fight for will be chosen randomly. Eaglestorm/MantisCompanyOffices, Crystar, Stephran, Jorcam.

8. Include weapons, such as torpedoes or missiles. (Make sure they can be fired) And remember, NO MODS

9. Include a download link (Required) and screenshot in your description. (not required, but it always helps.)

It's That simple!

Please note, Ships that are more aesthetically pleasing are more likely to be accepted.

Currently working on: Episode 2

Accepted Ships: Megalodon 720's Victory Class Battleship

~Manters

Edited November 23, 2014 by Manters
I have a naval ship that I made a while ago and now needs to be rebuilt. Do naval ships work?

something like this?

Unmanned missile platform, that itself is an even larger missile, and rams into other ships after it has unloaded its arsenal. Fast turn rate, powerful engines, shoots slow moving projectiles, but they pack a big punch, potentially shredding ships in half. Due to the projectiles lack of engines, it is virtually undetectable until it's too close to get out of the way.....but its drawback is its limited ammunition, lack of armor, and limited life span from its last ditch ramming protocol.

This is a support class platform designed primarily for crippling and destroying large vessels from afar (as long as they don't move much) and can be a game changer on the battlefield.

Edited November 10, 2014 by trekkie_

Love it! Very interesting design, Kerbtrek

Edited November 10, 2014 by Manters

I'll take them and I might use them for Battles over Laythe and Eve ,Designer225

Edited November 10, 2014 by Manters

Okay, Here's How it works. I am making a KSP Wars series. There will be more details on http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99632-KSP-Wars-Ship-submissions-page

This was just created to put it on the ship exchange page as well, as it belongs in both categories.

You can upload ships here and there, whichever works. Hoping for some submissions.

Ship submission Rules:

1. All craft must be stock. NO MODDED PARTS

2. All craft can be designed for zero gravity.

3. Infinite fuel, RCS and EVA fuel allowed.

4. No boosters required. All ships will launched into orbit by the secret weapon: "HYPEREDIT"

5. Give it a class name. EG: Wolf class cruiser, Destiny class fighter,

6. Put your name down in the craft description.

7. The side you fight for will be chosen randomly. Eaglestorm/MantisCompanyOffices, Crystar, Stephran, Jorcam.

8. Include weapons, such as torpedoes or missiles. (Make sure they can be fired) And remember, NO MODS

9. Include a download link (Required) and screenshot in your description. (not required, but it always helps.)

Edited November 14, 2014 by Manters
You should have a part count limit, a 1000 part ship exploding and sending debris flying is not really good for your computer.

These threads have been merged to avoid duplication of posts in two separate areas of the forum. And while we wish you well with your game, please keep in mind that rivalries between teams and fictional companies should not devolve in roleplaying arguments and feuds (2.2.j), or we may be forced to hand out infractions and close the thread.

These threads have been merged to avoid duplication of posts in two separate areas of the forum. And while we wish you well with your game, please keep in mind that rivalries between teams and fictional companies should not devolve in roleplaying arguments and feuds (2.2.j), or we may be forced to hand out infractions and close the thread.

By feuds, does this refer to the forum thread or to the actual series?

He means the forum thread.

BTW here's my submission: The 'Victory' class Battleship, 150 ish tons and armed with 8 large anti-ship missiles and a very strong outer shell.

Here's a picture:

Action Groups:

1: Activates solar panels.

2: Activates main engines.

0: Activates reverse engines. (To be used for rendezvous manoeuvres and for getting out of a fight if her mains have been blown off).

Download
